intro: Critesion violaceum, commonly known as the purple cress, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant features small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a slightly hairy texture. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
